articles.title: Boston Fleet’s Megan Keller scores in OT to give the United States Olympic gold in women’s hockey
articles.description:
Defender Megan Keller backhanded in a shot 4:07 into overtime and the United States won its third women’s hockey gold medal with a 2-1 victory over Canada at the Milan Cortina Games to close another thrilling chapter of one of sports most heated rivalries

The post Boston Fleet’s Megan Keller scores in OT to give the United States Olympic gold in women’s hockey appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Megan Keller scored in overtime, securing the U.S. women's hockey gold medal.
The victory marked the U.S.'s third gold in women's hockey at the Olympics.
Boston residents celebrate Keller's achievement, highlighting local talent on an international stage.

articles.title: Anti-abortion center’s lawsuit against Mass. officials gets tossed
articles.description:
Lawyers for Your Options Medical have vowed to appeal the dismissal.

The post Anti-abortion center’s lawsuit against Mass. officials gets tossed appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts officials dismissed a lawsuit from Your Options Medical on February 19, 2026.
Lawyers for the anti-abortion center plan to appeal the dismissal.
The ruling affects local access to reproductive health services in Boston.

articles.title: Trump visits Georgia, a target of his election falsehoods, as Republicans look for midterm boost
articles.description:
In the opening minutes of his first stop at a local restaurant, the president raised the prospect of voter fraud without evidence, talked up his plan to require voters to show identification before casting ballots, and discussed the recent FBI raid of election offices in the state's most populous county.

The post Trump visits Georgia, a target of his election falsehoods, as Republicans look for midterm boost appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Trump visited Georgia, discussing voter ID requirements and election integrity on February 19, 2026.
He raised unfounded claims of voter fraud, impacting local perceptions of election security.
Republican strategies may influence upcoming midterm elections in Boston and statewide voter engagement.
